sentence.Network_en: Ministers can equally credibly claim that the opposition is to blame.
sentence.Network_cn: 部长们也能同样令人信服地宣称，反对派应该受到指责。

sentence.Network_en: He was the only figure who could credibly run the country.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是有可能成功治理该国的唯一人选。

91.引言保险精算学中的信度理论(Credibility Theory)萌芽于20世纪20年代，至今已有80年的历史.在非寿险精算理论与实务中信度理论 …

entry.def: Credible means able to be trusted or believed.

example.ex: Baroness Thatcher's claims seem credible to many...
example.tran: 撒切尔女男爵的主张在很多人看来是可信的。

example.ex: But in order to maintain a credible threat of intervention, we have to maintain a credible alliance.
example.tran: 然而，为了保持确实有效的干预威胁，我们必须维持可靠的联盟。

entry.tran: (候选人、政策、体系等)有望成功的
entry.def: A credible candidate, policy, or system, for example, is one that appears to have a chance of being successful.

example.ex: Mr Robertson would be a credible candidate...
example.tran: 罗伯逊先生将是可能当选的候选人之一。

example.ex: The challenge before the opposition is to offer credible alternative policies for the future.
example.tran: 摆在反对党面前的挑战是如何为未来发展提出其他可行性政策。

means.word_mean: 1. easy to believe on the basis of available evidence;

auth_sentence.content: His laughter had a credibly rueful edge to it.
auth_sentence.res_content: His laughter had a credibly rueful edge to it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His laughter had a credibly rueful edge to it.

auth_sentence.content: But they cannot credibly conclude that is so.
auth_sentence.res_content: But they cannot credibly conclude that is so.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But they cannot credibly conclude that is so.

auth_sentence.content: No one credibly claims that there has been subsequent cooling.
auth_sentence.res_content: No one credibly claims that there has been subsequent cooling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No one credibly claims that there has been subsequent cooling.
